discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
C and D

Selected Answer: BC
B. Customize Entitlements: This permission is required to customize and configure entitlement management features in Salesforce, including creating and managing entitlement processes, templates, and milestones.
C. Manage Entitlements: This permission is specifically required for managing entitlements, which includes setting up entitlement processes, templates, and milestones. Without this permission, users will not be able to manage entitlements effectively.

The answer is correct. You can verify the answers from this link: 
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.entitlements_giving_users_access.htm&type=5

questions.question_text: Which two permissions need to be enabled to set up entitlement management, including milestones, entitlement processes, and entitlement templates? (Choose two.)

Cloud Kicks needs to track government-issued identification numbers for its customers. The security team requires that the identification number cannot be changed by users and must be masked when displayed, except the last two digits.

Which two recommended configurations should the administrator create? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: B and C cannot guarantee making the field uneditable by the users. B and D should be the answer

choices.D: Set Read-Only Field-Level Security in the user Profile.
choices.A: Use a field with Classic Encryption.

questions.question_text:
The VP of Marketing is launching campaigns in each region to target accounts that do NOT have open opportunities.
Which reporting solution can an administrator set up to assist with this?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I say B. I think the question is asking us to pull a report of accounts without opportunities. We don't need to pull any information from Campaigns.

Selected Answer: C
I think it's Joined. Although you an have up to four objects in a report type, these objects would require relationships to make them reportable with any other option. Acct and Opp can do it, but I can't find an option for Campaign when creating a report type - to add Accts/Opps anyway
Shouldn't it be joined report? We need 3 objects

Selected Answer: D
Although it might seem counterintuitive, the "Delete" permission on the Lead object is required for users to access the "Find Duplicates" button and merge duplicate leads.

Selected Answer: D
Its "D" for sure. 

I tested it in a demo org. "View all" does not activate the "Find duplicates" Button.
You have to select "Delete" on the permission set / profile in order to see the "Find duplicates" Button. I admit this is a difficult questions and also the help article is missleading...

Selected Answer: C
Question is just to find. So delete is not necessary
D. Si no esta el permiso de eliminar, el botón no se ve en el pagelayout en classic
Delete permission is needed for Leads to have access to the Find Duplicate button.

Selected Answer: D
Everyone pretty much agrees that you need to have delete permission to find the button.
https://trailhead.salesforce.com/trailblazer-community/feed/0D54S00000A7kSYSAZ

D
Tested

Answer is C.
Only merging needs delete access. Here they are saying you just need to see the lead records . And view all makes sure they see all the record even if they dont have access
Agreed D.

The answer is D - a user needs both Read and Delete permission on the Leads object. Since the states that the user is creating leads, this implies they can read the also read them (go into a test org and check for yourself...upon selecting create, edit is automatically checkboexed as well) meaning the remaining setting this user needs is the DELET permission on the Leads Object

it should be D. 
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.leads_merge_lex.htm&type=5

comments.content: the question is Find duplicate lead only NOT merge to answer is C
Correct! Users need to be able to read and delete the leads to have access to FInd Duplicate button.

questions.question_text:
An administrator wants to allow users who are creating leads to have access to the Find Duplicates button.
Which lead object-level permission will the administrator need to provide to these users?

discussion.content: Answer is B (Manual Sharing can be used for Sales users role, its classic feature only)

Answer is B
https://trailhead.salesforce.com/content/learn/projects/manage-products-prices-quotes-orders/control-access-price-books-products

Selected Answer: B
The correct answer is B. As OWD is org default. Here, the admin needs to just share it with 1 profile, not to the entire ORG.

comments.content: But how can you grant access to profile? (not users, groups, roles, or territories)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.products_sharing.htm&type=5

B.... If the OWD setting is changed to ‘No Access’ or ‘View Only’, the Sharing button is added to the page. This is for Salesforce Classic only. With manual sharing, access can be granted to groups, roles and users.
To me the answer should be to manually share the pricebook to the good roles... Not a sharing rule because no sharing rule is possible on price books right?
Answer is A

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers wants only users from the sales department to have access to price books.
How can an administrator meet this requirement?

choices.B: Manually share each price book to the sales users' profile
choices.D: Clone all custom price books from the standard price book
choices.C: Set the organization-wide default for price book to Use
choices.A: Create a sharing rule to share all price books to sales users
